com.qualcomm.phub.api.v1.deckofcards.rpc
Class RemoteDeckOfCardsManager_v1

java.lang.Object
  com.qualcomm.phub.api.v1.deckofcards.rpc.RemoteDeckOfCardsManager_v1
All Implemented Interfaces:
DeckOfCardsManager
public final class RemoteDeckOfCardsManager_v1
extends java.lang.Object
implements DeckOfCardsManager

Manager class through which a 3rd party app connects to the Toq app service, registers, sends notifications and manages its deck of cards app.

Author:
mcaunter

Method Detail

isRegistered

public boolean isRegistered()
                     throws DeckOfCardsException
Checks whether the current registration with the Qualcomm Toq app is valid, ensuring that the manager and service is in a state to permit re-registration if the current registration is invalid. This method should be called upon connecting to the service to determine whether (re-)registration is required.

Returns:
true if valid; false if not valid
Throws:
DeckOfCardsException

register

public void register()
              throws DeckOfCardsException
Register this app with the Qualcomm Toq app. This method must be called before installing a deck of cards or sending a notification and will trigger a UI interaction with the user requiring the user to accept the registration. Upon completion of the registration process, the RemoteDeckOfCardsListener will be called.

Throws:
DeckOfCardsException

sendNotification

public void sendNotification(ToqNotification notification)
                      throws DeckOfCardsException
Description copied from interface: DeckOfCardsManager
Sends the notification to the Qualcomm Toq app, which in turn will generate the pop-up on the watch. This method will return immediately and the pop-up will appear almost instantaneously.

Specified by:
sendNotification in interface DeckOfCardsManager
Throws:
DeckOfCardsException
See Also:
DeckOfCardsManager.sendNotification(com.qualcomm.phub.api.v1.deckofcards.ToqNotification)

isInstalled

public boolean isInstalled()
                    throws DeckOfCardsException
Returns a boolean indicating whether the deck of cards is installed.

Returns:
true if installed; false if not
Throws:
DeckOfCardsException

installDeckOfCards

public void installDeckOfCards(DeckOfCards deckOfCards,
                               DeckOfCardsIcon[] icons)
                        throws DeckOfCardsException
Description copied from interface: DeckOfCardsManager
Sends the deck of cards and icons to the Qualcomm Toq app, which in turn will install the deck of cards underneath the appropriate icon on the home screen on the watch. Although this method will return immediately, there may be a delay before the deck of cards appears on the watch.

Specified by:
installDeckOfCards in interface DeckOfCardsManager
icons - if null or 0 length, the watch will use a default icon
Throws:
DeckOfCardsException
See Also:
DeckOfCardsManager.installDeckOfCards(com.qualcomm.phub.api.v1.deckofcards.DeckOfCards, com.qualcomm.phub.api.v1.deckofcards.DeckOfCardsIcon[])

updateDeckOfCards

public void updateDeckOfCards(DeckOfCards deckOfCards)
                       throws DeckOfCardsException
Description copied from interface: DeckOfCardsManager
Sends the deck of cards to the Qualcomm Toq app, which in turn will update the deck of cards on the watch. Although this method will return immediately, there may be a delay before the deck of cards is updated on the watch.

Specified by:
updateDeckOfCards in interface DeckOfCardsManager
Throws:
DeckOfCardsException
See Also:
DeckOfCardsManager.updateDeckOfCards(com.qualcomm.phub.api.v1.deckofcards.DeckOfCards)

uninstallDeckOfCards

public void uninstallDeckOfCards()
                          throws DeckOfCardsException
Instructs the Qualcomm Toq app to remove the deck of cards from the watch. Although this method will return immediately, there will be a delay before the deck of cards disappears from the watch.

Throws:
DeckOfCardsException

unregister

public void unregister()
                throws DeckOfCardsException
Unregister this app with the Qualcomm Toq app. This method will automatically remove any existing deck of cards and notification references as part of the unregistration process.

Throws:
DeckOfCardsException
